div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 1313 Izmir (anc. Smyrna) environs, Ionia, (989) c. 1884 Burial: c. 200 B.C. Contents: 16 AE. With 8 blanks, lead weight, bronze and iron scraps Gambrium: 8 (as BMC 9 ff. [2]; 14 ff. [5]; 18 ff. [1]) Pergamum: 2 (as BMC 24-5 [1]; 54 ff. [1]) Aegae: 1 (as BMC 2 ff.) Cyme: 1 (as BMC 27 f.) Elaea: 1 (as BMC 6 ff.) Myrina: 1 (as BMC 20 ff.) Erythrae: 1 (as BMC 66 f.) Unc. mint: 1 Disposition: dispersed Hill, Essays and Studies Presented to William Ridgeway (Cambridge, 1913), pp. 110-5
